		<title>Climate Change Contributed to Neanderthals’ Demise, Study Suggests</title>
		<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~3/_6LQVdrNXzA/climate-change-neanderthals-demise-03861.html</link>
		<comments>http://www.sci-news.com/othersciences/anthropology/paleoanthropology/climate-change-neanderthals-demise-03861.html#comments</comments>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:08:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Editors</dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Paleoanthropology]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Climate change]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[France]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Homo neanderthalensis]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Neanderthal]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Paleoclimate]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38271</guid>
		<description>Neanderthals showed signs of nutritional stress during periods of extreme cold, according to a new study published in the July 2016 issue of the Journal of Human Evolution. “Our research uncovers a pattern showing that cold, harsh environments were stressful for Neanderthals,” said lead author Dr. Jamie Hodgkins, from the University of Colorado Denver. Dr. [...]<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=_6LQVdrNXzA:2aGIjGqA0K4:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=_6LQVdrNXzA:2aGIjGqA0K4:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=_6LQVdrNXzA:2aGIjGqA0K4:gIN9vFwOqvQ"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?i=_6LQVdrNXzA:2aGIjGqA0K4:gIN9vFwOqvQ" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~4/_6LQVdrNXzA" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

		<item>
		<title>Cynarctus wangi: New Species of Ancient Dog Found in Maryland</title>
		<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~3/qM8T8lSjtr0/cynarctus-wangi-new-species-dog-maryland-03860.html</link>
		<comments>http://www.sci-news.com/paleontology/cynarctus-wangi-new-species-dog-maryland-03860.html#comments</comments>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:29:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Editors</dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Paleontology]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Borophaginae]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Canine]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Dog]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Maryland]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Miocene]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[United States]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38267</guid>
		<description>A team of paleontologists has discovered a new species of fossil dog that was about the size of a coyote and lived on the coast of eastern North America in the middle Miocene, approximately 12 million years ago. Fossilized remains of the ancient dog, which was named Cynarctus wangi, were recovered from the Choptank Formation [...]<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=qM8T8lSjtr0:uboHjCa6sN4:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=qM8T8lSjtr0:uboHjCa6sN4:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=qM8T8lSjtr0:uboHjCa6sN4:gIN9vFwOqvQ"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?i=qM8T8lSjtr0:uboHjCa6sN4:gIN9vFwOqvQ" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
		<title>Archean Earth’s Upper Atmosphere Was Oxygen-Rich, Scientists Discover</title>
		<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~3/P2y6LDcgGuE/archean-earths-upper-atmosphere-oxygen-rich-03859.html</link>
		<comments>http://www.sci-news.com/othersciences/paleoclimatology/archean-earths-upper-atmosphere-oxygen-rich-03859.html#comments</comments>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:55:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Editors</dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Geoscience]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Paleoclimatology]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Archean]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Atmosphere]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Early Earth]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Earth]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Great Oxygenation Event]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Meteorite]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Methane]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Oxygen]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38258</guid>
		<description>An international team of researchers from Australia and the United Kingdom has made a surprising discovery about the chemistry of Earth’s upper atmosphere in the Archean era, about 2.7 billion years ago. The study, led by Monash University scientist Andrew Tomkins, indicates that Archean Earth’s upper atmosphere contained about the same amount of oxygen as [...]<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=P2y6LDcgGuE:LrsENil8-do:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=P2y6LDcgGuE:LrsENil8-do:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=P2y6LDcgGuE:LrsENil8-do:gIN9vFwOqvQ"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?i=P2y6LDcgGuE:LrsENil8-do:gIN9vFwOqvQ" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
		<title>Scientists Unearth 14K-Year-Old Bones of Extinct Bison antiquus</title>
		<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~3/qgKRlMWuf0I/bones-extinct-bison-antiquus-florida-03858.html</link>
		<comments>http://www.sci-news.com/paleontology/bones-extinct-bison-antiquus-florida-03858.html#comments</comments>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:57:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Enrico de Lazaro</dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Paleontology]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[American bison]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Bison]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Bison antiquus]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Florida]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Old Vero Man site]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38254</guid>
		<description>A team of scientists from Florida Atlantic University has uncovered the 14,000-year-old bones of Bison antiquus &#8212; a large-horned, extinct relative of the modern bison &#8212; at the Old Vero Man site in Florida. Sometimes referred to as the ancient bison, Bison antiquus is a direct ancestor of the extant American bison (Bison bison). The [...]<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=qgKRlMWuf0I:_cD67eRixhQ:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=qgKRlMWuf0I:_cD67eRixhQ:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=qgKRlMWuf0I:_cD67eRixhQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?i=qgKRlMWuf0I:_cD67eRixhQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~4/qgKRlMWuf0I" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

		<item>
		<title>Humans Arrived in Southern Arabia Earlier Than Thought</title>
		<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~3/MvwJ0K_NJNg/humans-arrived-southern-arabia-03857.html</link>
		<comments>http://www.sci-news.com/genetics/humans-arrived-southern-arabia-03857.html#comments</comments>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 21:35:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Enrico de Lazaro</dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Genetics]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Paleoanthropology]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Africa]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Arabia]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[DNA]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Homo sapiens]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Human]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Ice Age]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[mtDNA]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Pleistocene]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38240</guid>
		<description>An international team of genetic researchers from the United States and Europe has found new evidence that there was an Ice Age refugium in southern Arabia. Once the Ice Age receded &#8212; with the onset of the Late Glacial period about 15,000 years ago &#8212; the people of the refugium dispersed and populated Arabia and [...]<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=MvwJ0K_NJNg:_ZJpTSxssqE:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=MvwJ0K_NJNg:_ZJpTSxssqE:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=MvwJ0K_NJNg:_ZJpTSxssqE:gIN9vFwOqvQ"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?i=MvwJ0K_NJNg:_ZJpTSxssqE:gIN9vFwOqvQ" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~4/MvwJ0K_NJNg" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

		<item>
		<title>Kepler-223: Astronomers Find System with Four Giant Planets Trapped in Resonance</title>
		<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~3/8F1MY8sw-34/kepler-223-system-planets-resonance-03856.html</link>
		<comments>http://www.sci-news.com/astronomy/kepler-223-system-planets-resonance-03856.html#comments</comments>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 18:44:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Editors</dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Astronomy]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Exoplanet]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Kepler]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Kepler-223]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[NASA]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Solar System]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[sub-Neptune]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38236</guid>
		<description>The Kepler-223 multi-planet system is trapped in an orbital configuration that the Solar System’s four gas giants may have broken from in its early history, according to a team of scientists led by University of Chicago astronomer Sean Mills. “Exactly how and where planets form is an outstanding question in planetary science. Our work essentially [...]<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=8F1MY8sw-34:F7rlLmCe_mE:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=8F1MY8sw-34:F7rlLmCe_mE:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=8F1MY8sw-34:F7rlLmCe_mE:gIN9vFwOqvQ"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?i=8F1MY8sw-34:F7rlLmCe_mE:gIN9vFwOqvQ" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~4/8F1MY8sw-34" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>http://www.sci-news.com/astronomy/kepler-223-system-planets-resonance-03856.html/feed</wfw:commentRss>

		<item>
		<title>Australian Archaeologists Find Fragment of World’s Oldest-Known Axe</title>
		<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~3/jWuB4T4VrOs/fragment-worlds-oldest-known-axe-03855.html</link>
		<comments>http://www.sci-news.com/archaeology/fragment-worlds-oldest-known-axe-03855.html#comments</comments>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 15:04:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Editors</dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Archaeology]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Australia]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Stone axe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38229</guid>
		<description>A team of archaeologists from the University of Sydney, the Australian National University and the University of Western Australia has unearthed a small fragment from the edge of 46,000-49,000-year-old stone axe. An analysis of the fragment was published online in the journal Australian Archaeology this week. The axe fragment is about the size of a [...]<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=jWuB4T4VrOs:YrMKN25ueGQ:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=jWuB4T4VrOs:YrMKN25ueGQ:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=jWuB4T4VrOs:YrMKN25ueGQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?i=jWuB4T4VrOs:YrMKN25ueGQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~4/jWuB4T4VrOs" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>http://www.sci-news.com/archaeology/fragment-worlds-oldest-known-axe-03855.html/feed</wfw:commentRss>

		<item>
		<title>Astronomers Confirm 1,284 New Kepler Exoplanets</title>
		<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~3/xI8IZ8I2gGA/1284-new-kepler-exoplanets-03854.html</link>
		<comments>http://www.sci-news.com/astronomy/1284-new-kepler-exoplanets-03854.html#comments</comments>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 11:07:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Sergio Prostak</dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Astronomy]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Exoplanet]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Habitable zone]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Kepler]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[NASA]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38219</guid>
		<description>A team of astronomers from NASA and Princeton University has confirmed that 1,284 extrasolar objects by NASA’s planet-hunting Kepler spacecraft are indeed exoplanets. Reported in the Astrophysical Journal this week, it is the largest single finding of exoplanets to date and more than doubles the number of confirmed exoplanets discovered by NASA’s Kepler Space Telescope [...]<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=xI8IZ8I2gGA:vQQgS4xCmOU:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=xI8IZ8I2gGA:vQQgS4xCmOU:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?a=xI8IZ8I2gGA:vQQgS4xCmOU:gIN9vFwOqvQ"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/BreakingScienceNews?i=xI8IZ8I2gGA:vQQgS4xCmOU:gIN9vFwOqvQ" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~4/xI8IZ8I2gGA" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
		<wfw:commentRss>http://www.sci-news.com/astronomy/1284-new-kepler-exoplanets-03854.html/feed</wfw:commentRss>

		<item>
		<title>NASA’s SOFIA Observatory Detects Atomic Oxygen in Upper Atmosphere of Mars</title>
		<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/BreakingScienceNews/~3/_5I83vTpUVQ/nasas-sofia-atomic-oxygen-mars-03853.html</link>
		<comments>http://www.sci-news.com/space/planetaryscience/nasas-sofia-atomic-oxygen-mars-03853.html#comments</comments>
		<pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 20:19:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Enrico de Lazaro</dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Planetary Science]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Atmosphere]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Mars]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[NASA]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Oxygen]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[SOFIA]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38207</guid>
		<description>NASA’s Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA), the largest airborne observatory in the world, has detected atomic oxygen in the upper layers of the Martian atmosphere. 		<description>Nearly two years ago, an international team of paleontologists discovered a bizarre fossil &#8212; Atopodentatus unicus, a 10 feet (3 m) long marine reptile that lived in what is now China 247 to 242 million years ago (Middle Triassic). 		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38163</guid>
		<description>This new image from the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope is likely the best of the grand-design spiral galaxy NGC 6814. NGC 6814, also known as LEDA 63545 or 2MASX J19424057-1019255, is an 11.2-magnitude face-on grand-design spiral galaxy. It lies in the northern constellation Aquila, 74.4 million light-years from Earth. According to astronomers, “when we look [...]<div class="feedflare">

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38130</guid>
		<description>In a paper published in the journal Genetics, scientists from the University of North Dakota and the University of Minnesota present multiple lines of evidence linking a gene called CIRBP to temperature-dependent sex determination in common snapping turtles (Chelydra serpentina). In crocodiles, alligators, and certain lizard and turtle species, an embryo can become either a [...]<div class="feedflare">

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38124</guid>
		<description>According to a team of scientists led by Prof. Sara Seager from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, gases emitted by alien life forms on habitable extrasolar planets could be detected remotely by telescopes, but these gases might have quite different compositions from those in the atmosphere of our planet. “Thousands of exoplanets are known to [...]<div class="feedflare">

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38119</guid>
		<description>In a study published online in the journal Science, paleontologists from China and the United States report the discovery of a diverse primate fauna from the early Oligocene of southern China. According to scientists, primates are sensitive to shifts in temperature, and thus, to climate change. Changes in the distribution of primate fossils throughout time [...]<div class="feedflare">

		<description>An international team of astronomers led by Dr. Aaron Barth of the University of California, Irvine, has derived a precise measurement of the mass of a supermassive black hole at the center of the giant elliptical galaxy NGC 1332. NGC 1332, otherwise known as ESO 548-18 and LEDA 12838, is an almost-edge-on elliptical galaxy in [...]<div class="feedflare">

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.sci-news.com/?p=38099</guid>
		<description>An international team of scientists has described a previously unknown species of wasp from South Africa and has named it Conobregma bradpitti, after the American actor and producer Brad Pitt. Conobregma bradpitti belongs to a widespread group of wasps parasitizing moth and butterfly caterpillars. “These wasps lay their eggs into a host, which once parasitized [...]<div class="feedflare">
